title: Prep work for GE and CPU on separate threads
description: This time there shouldn't be any deviation in behavior. It might hurt performance a tiny bit but afaict the difference is negligible. Threadsafe events were kinda buggy before, especially with remove and the added unschedule. More importantly, they weren't based on the same starting time, which I had not realized. I don't think GetTicks() will ever return garbage, so I just called it like always. Because savestates need to be run outside a syscall, and the above makes threadsafe events run inside them (so there's no change in behavior), this just handles savestates more specially. They've already got a good chunk of code throughout dedicated to them, so they might as well be special. Fixes the differences I could reproduce, but makes savestate actions slightly more delayed. Does open the door better for "rewind" (frame based) if that can be practical. -[Unknown]

To be able to let the compiler do this work for us in the future I've added the override keywoard to all overriden methods I could find. Furthermore I've noticed that CWinSystemX11 derived from ISettingCallback but doesn't override any of its virtual methods so I've removed it. Last but not least I've noticed that CWakeOnAccess uses the OnSettingsSaved() callback of ISettinsHandler to "monitor" the wake on access setting value which is not reliable. Therefore I've changed it to use ISettingCallback::OnSettingChanged() on that specific setting.

title: [Music] Tidy up CSong and CAlbum  by removing artist vector
description: Tidy up the way artist data is handled in CSong and CAlbum. Since Gotham we have used a vector of artist credits - an object with both artist name and MusicbrainzID - for artists, but left the legacy string vector duplicating where the names were held. For robustness and consistency the move to using artist credits needs to be completed, and the artist string vector removed. The changes in this PR depend upon #8079 (CMusicInfoTag MBID setting) due for merge when the window reopens, so those are incuded here. This made methods available that return a string vector from the song or album artist credits as required. I implementing this change it revealed some places (in JSON interface and album info scraping) where the string vector was being set but the change not propagated to the artist credits, and therefore the database. This is a bug that needs fixing, but I believe a separate PR is best, so for now there are some small bits of code are commented out - they didn't work so no loss! @evilhamster perhaps you will check this out for me. @zag2me , @jdd-uk you may have guessed this was coming.

title: Tag loading  for dsf, opus etc. music files extracted using ffmpeg
description: Extend tag parsing done by the ffmpeg tag loader to include more ID3v2 tags in line with those loaded by Taglib for other format music files. Most significant is album artist, without it Kodi was incorrectly interpreting albums with varied song artists as always being a compilation. I got the key names ffmpeg uses by experimenting with a fully tagged dsf file. The key thing to note is that ffmpeg does not return multi-value keys, just the first value for a key. Hence users will need to treat in the same way as using ID3v2.3 tag, using only single frame values and an item separator ( " / " by default) to indicate the individual artists, album artists, genres etc. A delayed followup to #8925 and as such could be backported @fritsch and maybe @notspiff To test this you need fully tagged dsf or opus etc. music files.

title: Change CVideoSync stop flag from atomic bool to CEvent
description: CVideoSync implementers take a bool reference as stop signal for the processing. Change that to a CEvent. [Description] Some windowing implementations do not need an extra thread to update the video clock. If they just get a bool to know when to stop the thread (that does nothing), they have to wake up every few milliseconds to poll the flag. Each wake-up costs a context switch that is not needed. Passing a stop CEvent instead is more flexible: CVideoSync implementers can still poll the flag if needed, but it is also possible to let the whole thread sleep until the stop is requested without intermittent wake-ups.I've avoided modifying the windowing implementations for which I was not sure how to correctly preserve the previous behavior and could not test myself. [Motivation and Context] Want to avoid needless context switches and polling if it's easily doable :-)

description: Many users like to adjust "epg linger time" to zero, because for live tv, they are not interested in what was broadcasted in the past. Before this PR, those users had to deal with advanced settings (epg.lingertime) to make their programme guide fit their needs. This PR changes this by making "lingertime" an official setting (and removing the respective advanced setting). BTW: The new setting can be adjusted in the range from 0 to 31 days, default is 1 day (like the default for epg lingertime advanced setting was).
